result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI ( 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,400.00, DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of two (2) years.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18 Judge Colon.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (26 pages) commencing JUNE 22, 2015, received and filed.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter; filed.

Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for 116 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $2,400.00.  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 2 years.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 2 years.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on defense motion to suppress.
Sworn and testified:  Officer David Waliszewski.
Testimony closed.
Closing arguments.
COURT'S RULING:  Court DENIED defense motion to suppress.

Case adjourned to 06-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
for an Evidentiary Hearing (Stop Motion) filed by Atty. Edgar Lin on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Johnny Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests a stop motion hearing date.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Stop Motion Hearing.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Johnny Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense need time to review the DNA report.
Case adjourned to 04-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Donald, Br. 2.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Johnny Gonzalez in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
AODA Form placed in file
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
